page.title: 10THE BATTLE OF LEWES
page.content: In 1264 {Simon De Montfort}defeated {King Henry III}and his son {Edward } during the {Battle of Lewes}, and took both of them prisoner.It changed the ruling of the Country from Royalist to Parliamentary.The battle took place on the Downs N.W. of the town but there is no evidence of it now,but the maps show that Prince Edward's advance went right through where our school now stands, and we play football on the ground just below the castle.A housing estate and a large corn field now covers most of the major battle field and many roads in this area are named after people from both sides,such as {King Henrys Rd,De Montfort Rd,Prince {Edwards Rd,Leicester Rd}and{Simons {track.}The Battle site can be seen on an Ordnance Survey map of this area, by the date 1264 and a symbol of crossed swords.BY DAN,JEREMY AND CHRIS
